title: Lloyds Banking drops on saying up to £1.8 billion on extra PPI claims and halting buyback
text: Lloyds Banking Group LLOY, -1.98% LYG, +0.00% dropped in early London trade after becoming the latest British bank to report rising claims for payment protection insurance, saying it will have to take an additional charge in the range of £1.2 billion to £1.8 billion ($2.2 billion). "In line with the broader market, the volume of PIRs received in August was higher than expected, with a significant spike in the final days before the deadline expired," the bank said. The bank said it has decided to suspend the remainder of the 2019 buyback program, with around £600 million of the up to £1.75 billion program expected to be unused at mid-September.
